page.title: 06PARISH HALL, BLEASDALE
page.content:
Bleasdale Parish Hall was built by voluntary labour.It was built from stones brought from the ruins of cottages of the village of Coolam.This was a hamlet near Hazlehurst where the inhabitants used to make hats,woven from oat straw and also do wool combing.
The Parish Hall has a sprung maple floor for dancing,and a large stage.It was improved in 1984.
It is used for Parish Parties, Dances, the school Nativity Play,Socials on Bonfire Night and at Harvest,Whist and Domino Drives,Turkey Supper and many other entertainments.Bleasdale Farmers Club and the Youth Club also meet there.
